business.headline: SIP investments hit record high in December 2025: AMFIThe latest data from the Association of Mutual Funds in India (AMFI) for December 2025 shows steady participation from retail investors, record SIP contributions and sustained interest in equity and hybrid schemes.
Is it possible for the US to put a price tag on Greenland?In 1946, the US offered to buy the vast, mineral-rich Arctic island from Denmark for $100 million, an offer that was rejected back then.

Will your PF keep earning interest after you have left job?Changing jobs is common today, but doubts around Provident Fund savings still linger. Many employees worry that their PF stops growing once they leave a job. The truth, however, is very different and often misunderstood.

Tax relief on the cards? What to expect from Budget 2026Changes to tax slabs, a higher exemption limit and a continued push towards the new tax regime helped reduce the tax burden for many families and eased pressure on households in budget 2025.
Sensex closes 605 points lower, Nifty below 25,700; NTPC down 2%The S&P BSE Sensex tanked 604.72 points to close at 83,576.24, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 193.55 points to end at 25,683.30.

Gold, silver rates today: What should investors know amid global turmoilGold prices in India moved higher across all major purity levels on January 9. The price of 24K gold stood at Rs 13,871 per gram, up by Rs 71 from the previous session.

Govt ducks IMF's 'C' grade criticism in stunning RTI stonewall: No answers, no fixesOn the estimation of GDP and Gross Value Added (GVA) for the unorganised sector, MoSPI said it follows methodologies outlined in official documents released in 2012 and 2015, both available in the public domain.

Budget 2026: Hoping for a tax makeover? Why you might be disappointed this yearHoping Budget 2026 will finally bring sweeping tax changes? Experts suggest this may not be the year for big announcements or dramatic relief.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO fully booked on Day 1. Should you subscribe?BCCL IPO: The allotment is expected to be finalised on January 14, 2026. Shares are proposed to list on the BSE and NSE on January 16, 2026.

Is sector rotation the real driver of returns in Indian equity markets?Sector rotation in its simplest form is the reaction of the market to shifts in the economic environment. The various sectors are enjoyed at various stages of the cycle.

Sensex falls over 600 points: What's behind the bloodbath on Dalal Street?Around 12:46 pm, the BSE Sensex was down 634.91 points to 83,546.05, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 188.80 points to 25,688.05. Most of the broader market indices also tumbled, reflecting the volatility on Dalal Street.

Still not received your income tax refund in 2026? Here's why it's taking timeWaiting endlessly for your tax refund can be stressful. If your FY 2024–25 income tax refund has not arrived yet in 2026, there are several common reasons behind the delay.

Trump's 500% tariff threat rattles Dalal Street. What should investors do now?Around 11:55 am, the Sensex was down nearly 450 points, while the NSE Nifty 50 had tumbled over 130 points, pushing the benchmark indices deeper into the red after a bruising week.

Budget 2026: Why insurance sector needs more than an FDI boostWith FDI reforms in place, Budget 2026 must prioritise affordability, trust and protection-led incentives to close India's insurance gap and turn reform momentum into real coverage for citizens.

Mutual fund inflows cool off in December, down 6% to Rs 28,054 croreData released by the Association of Mutual Funds in India, or AMFI, showed that inflows into equity mutual funds fell 6% in December to Rs 28,054 crore.

BHEL share price jumps over 4%. Why is the stock rising today?BHEL shares were trading at Rs 282.40, up Rs 10.10 or 3.71% as of 10:10 AM. The stock had closed at Rs 272.30 in the last session. It opened higher at Rs 279.10 and moved up further during the day..
Sensex gains over 200 points, Nifty above 25,900; BEL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 35.21 points to 84,145.75, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 19.80 points to 25,857.50 as of 9:28 am.

Sensex, Nifty trade setup: Will stock market fall again today?Both Sensex and Nifty have seen steady losses over the past four sessions. Nifty has fallen 1.7% during this period, while Sensex is down 1.8%.

Bharat Coking Coal IPO opens for bidding, but GMP falls. Should you apply?BCCL IPO: The allotment is expected to be finalised on January 14, 2026. Shares are proposed to be listed on the BSE and NSE, with a tentative listing date of January 16, 2026.

India defends antitrust penalty law as Apple risks $38 billion fineThe company fears it could be fined up to $38 billion if the global turnover calculation is used, after a CCI investigation found it had abused its position on its app store. Apple denies the accusations.

entertainment.headline: Brooklyn Beckham sends legal notice to David, Victoria amid family rift: Report Brooklyn Beckham has reportedly sent a legal notice to his parents, David and Victoria Beckham. The notice restricts them from tagging him in social media posts. The development comes after a series of strained interactions between Brooklyn, his wife Nicola Peltz, and his family.

RGV calls censor board outdated after Madras High Court stay on Jana Nayagan Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has called the Censor Board outdated amid the ongoing Jana Nayagan certification row. His comments come as the Madras High Court temporarily halted the film's U/A certificate.

Kate Winslet hints at Mare of Easttown 2, filming likely in 2027 Kate Winslet has confirmed that serious discussions are underway for a second season of HBO's acclaimed series Mare of Easttown. There is a strong possibility that production will begin in 2027.

Geetu Mohandas defends Toxic teaser, talks about female pleasure and consent Director Geetu Mohandas has addressed public criticism following the release of the teaser for Toxic: A Fairy Tale for Grown-Ups. Her response came after viewers raised concerns about the portrayal of a female character in the teaser.

Not scared of Dhurandhar 2 or Toxic: Mukesh Bhatt on Emraan Hashmi Awarapan 2 delay Awarapan 2 has been delayed after Emraan Hashmi's on-set injury. Producer Mukesh Bhatt has cleared the air on the delay and denied rumours about avoiding box office competition.

Fans mob Amitabh Bachchan in Surat, video sparks online conern Veteran actor Amitabh Bachchan was surrounded by a large crowd during his arrival in Surat for the Indian Street Premier League Season 3.

Anupam Kher celebrates Tanvi The Great's entry in Oscars 2026 race Anupam Kher celebrated Tanvi The Great entering the Oscars 2026 race, calling it a major milestone for the team. The film's global recognition comes alongside its successful 100-day run in theatres.

Bottle, glasses and a moment: Sandeep Reddy Vanga explains Spirit's poster Filmmaker Sandeep Reddy Vanga has explained the poster of his upcoming action film Spirit. The poster, featuring lead actors Prabhas and Triptii Dimri, draws from a key scene in the movie.

Chitrangda Singh recalls being mobbed with John Abraham, flags safety concerns Chitrangda Singh has raised concerns over celebrity safety at public events, recalling a scary mobbing incident she experienced with John Abraham during a film promotion.

Madras High Court says Jana Nayagan makers pressured system for early release call The Madras High Court has temporarily stayed the issuance of the U/A certificate for Vijay's film Jana Nayagan. The court criticised the makers for fixing a release date without the certificate.

Amaan Ali Bangash on why Indian classical music must evolve without compromise At Swami Haridas–Tansen Mahotsav in Delhi, sarod player Amaan Ali Bangash speaks on tradition, adaptation, and why Indian classical music is far from dying.

Laalo director on comparisons with OMG, Trapped: Those are legendary works As the Gujarati film Laalo – Krishna Sada Sahaayate released in Hindi, director Ankit Sakhiya addressed comparisons with movies like OMG and Trapped. Laalo leans into spirituality and the presence of God as a character.

The Raja Saab X review: Prabhas starrer is an ultra disaster, says social media Prabhas's latest film, The Raja Saab, has released in cinemas but has received largely unfavourable reactions on social media. Several users gave the movie low ratings and labelled it a disaster.

Emraan Hashmi weighs in on Dhurandhar's success: Industry often runs down films Emraan Hashmi praises the success of Dhurandhar and criticises the industry's negative mindset. He also shares updates on his upcoming Netflix series and Awarapan 2 film release.

Madras High Court flags 'dangerous trend' after Censor Board delays Jana Nayagan The Madras High Court cleared Jana Nayagan with a U/A 16+ certificate and reprimanded the CBFC for eleventh-hour objections that pushed the film's release. Starring Vijay, the film is now aiming for a Pongal 2026 release.

Emraan Hashmi on viral cameo in The Ba***ds of Bollywood: Nothing changed for me Emraan Hashmi says the viral response to his cameo in The Ba**ds of Bollywood has not changed anything for him, as he prefers to stay detached from success and online hype.
From Spider-Man to anime: Shubman Gill joins the rising wave Indian cricketer Shubman Gill enters the anime wave as the genre moves from niche fandoms to mainstream pop culture in India.

O Romeo: Shahid Kapoor's blood-soaked, tattooed look stuns in first poster Shahid Kapoor adopts a groundbreaking look for Vishal Bhardwaj's upcoming film O Romeo, produced by Sajid Nadiadwala. Releasing February 13, 2026, this marks the duo's fourth collaboration.

Varun Dhawan reacts to trolling over Border 2 song Ghar Kab Jaoge Varun Dhawan addressed social media criticism about his role in the song Ghar Kab Aaoge from Border 2, responding with light-hearted remarks while preparing for the film's release.

general news.headline: Owning the sea: US boasts after intercepting 3rd oil tanker in 3 days, shares videoThe Olina is the fifth tanker seized by US forces and the third in the last three days under a broader effort by President Donald Trump's administration to choke the global distribution of Venezuelan oil products following the U.S. ouster of President Nicolás Maduro in a surprise overnight raid.

I have pen drives against Amit Shah: Mamata Banerjee warns of coal scam reveal  UpdatesMamata Banerjee alleged that all proceeds from the coal scam ultimately went to Amit Shah. She further claimed that the funds were routed through BJP MP from Bengal, Jagannath Sarkar and Leader of Opposition in the Bengal Assembly, Suvendu Adhikari. She added that she had kept silent out of respect for the chair she holds.

What India said on Trump aide's 'Modi didn't call for trade deal' remarksExternal Affairs Ministry Spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal said India remains committed to pursuing a mutually beneficial trade agreement between the two complementary economies and is keen to bring the talks to a conclusion.

Madras High Court says Jana Nayagan makers pressured system for early release callThe Madras High Court has temporarily stayed the issuance of the U/A certificate for Vijay's film Jana Nayagan. The court criticised the makers for fixing a release date without the certificate.

Why Modi might have avoided that one phone call to TrumpUS President Donald Trump is the undisputed king of the post-truth world. Trump has the knack of misrepresenting facts, if not spreading outright fake news. That is the reason why PM Modi might not have made that one call, despite having telephonic conversations with Trump eight times in 2025.

MI vs RCB Live Score: WPL 2026: RCB (57/2 in 6 ov), Mumbai back in huntMumbai Indians Women (MI) vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Women (RCB) Live Score: Mumbai Indians have clawed their way back into this contest as both Smriti Mandhana and Grace Harris were dismissed after a quickfire start. Bengaluru are already running out of batters.

High Court judge leaves courtroom due to chaos during Trinamool vs ED hearingDespite repeated warnings from Justice Suvra Ghosh, order was not restored in the courtroom. Issuing a stern warning, she asked lawyers not associated with the case to leave within five minutes, failing which she said she would step out. However, confusion erupted among the lawyers, who began arguing and jostling over who would stay and who would leave.

SC blasts Sharmila Tagore's stray dog arguments: Completely removed from realityThe Supreme Court sharply criticised actor Sharmila Tagore's submissions in the stray dog case as "completely divorced from reality," rejecting attempts to glorify the presence of strays in sensitive spaces like hospitals.

Bengaluru Zepto rider brutally assaulted in road rage, viral video sparks outrageIn a case of road rage, two men brutally assaulted a Zepto delivery boy after their scooty collided with his bike. The incident was caught on camera and later became viral, initiating police action. Video inside the story...

Dense fog to return over North India on Saturday after unexpected rainThick fog is likely over Punjab and the northern districts of Rajasthan, with conditions favourable for reduced visibility during morning and late-night hours.

Did Canada's lenient parole system enable Indian student's murder?The country of Canada has a rather lenient system of paroles, designed to make convicts into law-abiding citizens by allowing them a limited degree of freedom under supervision. However, the murder of an Indian student, Shivank Avasthi by a convicted criminal who was deemed low risk while being granted parole, points out to serious faults within the system.

Censor board Centre's puppet: Stalin backs Jana Nayagan amid certification rowThe DMK chief's reaction came just hours after Jana Nayagan ran into another hurdle, as the Madras High Court asked the CBFC to temporarily hold back the film's certificate for now.

Maa Inti Bangaaram teaser trailer: Samantha plays housewife who is anything but thatThe teaser trailer for Maa Inti Bangaaram, starring Samantha Ruth Prabhu, was released on Friday. It offered a glimpse into a film that explores strength, vulnerability and family bonds.

Owner of Swiss bar, where 40 died in fire, detained over potential flight riskThe detention of Jacques Moretti came five days after the prosecutors announced that no coercive measures had been ordered against the defendants, as the administration had not met the pre-trial conditions following the incident.

Unfortunate day, sets unsettling precedent: I-PAC on ED raids at Bengal officeThe ED's raids on I-PAC's office and its chief Pratik Jain's residence triggered a sharp political confrontation in West Bengal ahead of the election.
This city has the most polluted air in India. It's not Delhi190 Indian cities exceed the annual PM10 safe-limit, while 103 cities exceed the annual PM2.5 standard.

The Raja Saab X review: Prabhas starrer is an ultra disaster, says social mediaPrabhas's latest film, The Raja Saab, has released in cinemas but has received largely unfavourable reactions on social media. Several users gave the movie low ratings and labelled it a disaster.

We'll shoot first, talk later: Denmark warns US as Greenland dispute hots upThe 1952 Cold War-era rule, which was created when Nazi Germany attacked Denmark in April 1940 leading to a partial collapse of communications in the Scandinavian nation, has remained in place till date.

Greenland vs America: The 1,000-year-old Viking story behind today's standoffAs the US renews interest in Greenland, Nordic countries are standing united. The standoff has revived memories of a forgotten chapter from history — when Viking settlers from Greenland reached North America centuries before Columbus, triggering violent clashes that ended in retreat and shaped Greenland's enduring strategic importance.

What options do Trump and Khamenei have amid rising US-Iran tensionsDonald Trump has again turned his attention to Iran, seven months after US bombers attacked key nuclear sites in Tehran. It comes amid unrest in Iran and days after the US captured Venezuelan President Nicholas Maduro. With tensions rising in the Middle East, here is a look at what options Trump and Khamenei have.

The Leela, Udaipur fined Rs 10 lakh for privacy violation; guests were in bathroomA Chennai consumer court ordered The Leela Palace, Udaipur, to pay Rs 10 lakh compensation after holding the hotel guilty of privacy violation and service deficiency, following unlawful room entry by housekeeping staff.

When BCCI's Jogu Da helped Bangladesh cricket pass crucial TestFormer BCCI president and then ICC chief Jagmohan Dalmiya played a decisive role in Bangladesh becoming the 10th nation to gain Test status through a unanimous vote in June 2000. India strongly backed Bangladesh's case, and that support proved crucial.

Millions leave India to study abroad. But almost none come here to studyIndia is among the world's largest exporters of students, but attracts less than 1% of global inbound learners in return. A NITI Aayog report flips the study-abroad obsession to expose India's failure as a global education destination, and shows why the imbalance hurts prestige, economy and long-term talent goals.

TCS halts appraisals of WFH employees after new 5-day office attendance mandateTCS has paused final anniversary appraisals for some employees who did not meet its strict five-day work-from-office requirement, linking attendance compliance directly to performance outcomes.

sports.headline: Virat Kohli can't stop smiling after meeting mini doppelganger, moment goes viral Virat Kohli shared a light moment during an India training session in Vadodara after meeting a young fan who closely resembled him. The photo quickly went viral as fans compared the child to Kohli's childhood pictures ahead of the New Zealand ODI series.

After Ashes debacle, McCullum admits he could be replaced as England coach Following England's 4-1 Ashes series loss to Australia, Brendon McCullum admitted there could be "someone better" suited to be head coach if he is not "able to steer the ship."

Virat, Rohit are incredible: Young explains Indian duo's influence on NZ camp India vs New Zealand: Ahead of the three-match ODI series, Will Young admitted it was no surprise to see Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma back at their best, explaining how the Indian stars inspire the Blackcaps camp.

Back in semis of Super 1000 after 5 years, PV Sindhu focused on one day at a time PV Sindhu has made a strong return to competitive badminton by reaching the Malaysia Open semi-finals after a four-month injury break. Her focus remains on fitness and mental strength as she eyes the Los Angeles Olympics 2027 and plans to play for a few more years.

24 hours after Ashes win, Head steals show with remarkable putt at Blitz golf Just 24 hours after securing the Ashes trophy, Travis Head showed off his skills on the golf course, hitting a remarkable putt. Head was the highest run-getter in the Ashes this time and scored three hundreds.

Ashes debacle in Australia will haunt England for years: Michael Atherton Former England captain Michael Atherton believes England will be "haunted" for years by their latest Ashes failure in Australia, after being thoroughly outplayed in the five-match series. The Ben Stokes-led side endured a disappointing tour, eventually losing the contest 1-4 as Australia dominated across conditions to retain the urn.

MI vs RCB Live Score: WPL 2026: RCB (47/2 in 5 ov), Mumbai back in hunt Mumbai Indians Women (MI) vs Royal Challengers Bengaluru Women (RCB) Live Score: Mumbai Indians have clawed their way back into this contest as both Smriti Mandhana and Grace Harris were dismissed after a quickfire start. Bengaluru are already running out of batters.

Pietersen recommends IPL-winning coach to replace McCullum: He gets Test cricket Kevin Pietersen recommended England to bring back a former coach to replace Brendon McCullum as Test coach following their poor performance in the Ashes 2025-26. England lost the series 1-4.

Sincaraz united? Carlos Alcaraz, Jannik Sinner hint at historic doubles pairing Carlos Alcaraz and Jannik Sinner express interest in joining forces for doubles as they prepare for a South Korean exhibition, reflecting on their rivalry and challenges of the crowded tennis calendar.

Indian agent: BCB official sparks outrage after bizarre remark on Tamim Iqbal BCB official M. Nazmul Islam sparked widespread outrage after calling former Bangladesh captain Tamim Iqbal an "Indian agent," intensifying tensions already heightened by Mustafizur Rahman's exit from the Indian Premier League.

Who should be next Manchester United manager? Roy Keane reveals his pick Roy Keane has publicly named Newcastle United manager Eddie Howe as his preferred candidate to replace Ruben Amorim at Manchester United. Howe has helped Newcastle United win the League Cup last season and head back to the Champions League.

Manchester City sign Ghana forward Antoine Semenyo from AFC BournemouthManchester City have confirmed the signing of Antoine Semenyo from AFC Bournemouth for £65 million, a landmark deal that ranks among the most expensive transfers ever involving a Ghanaian player.

Virat Kohli should reverse Test retirement: T20 World Cup winner makes bold callT20 World Cup winner Robin Uthappa has urged star Indian batter Virat Kohli to reverse his Test retirement ahead of the upcoming three-match ODI series against New Zealand.

Kenya tennis admits wildcard blunder after player's embarrassing defeat goes viralA first-round match at the ITF W35 Nairobi tournament has prompted public scrutiny and an official response from Tennis Kenya over the awarding of a wildcard to Egyptian player Hajar Abdelkader. Hajar managed to win only three points and lost 0-6, 0-6 in her professional tennis debut.

WPL 2026: Meg Lanning vs Jemimah Rodrigues off-field banter steals the showUP Warriorz captain Meg Lanning shared playful off-field banter with her former teammate and Delhi Capitals skipper Jemimah Rodrigues during a pre-tournament show ahead of WPL 2026.

Arsenal's Martinelli 'deeply sorry' for pushing injured Bradley in Liverpool drawArsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has apologised for his actions during the 0-0 Premier League draw against Liverpool after pushing injured defender Conor Bradley off the pitch.

Jay Shah has never held a bat, cricket ecosystem is hijacked: Ex BCB secretarySyed Ashraful Haque has criticised the politicisation of cricket administration in Asia amid rising tensions between BCB and BCCI over Mustafizur Rahman issue. The row threatens the T20 World Cup 2026 schedule, with Bangladesh seeking to shift matches outside India due to security concerns.

T20 World Cup row: Ex-captain cautions Bangladesh against bowing to public opinionFormer captain Tamim Iqbal has warned against decisions driven by public sentiment as Bangladesh's participation in the T20 World Cup in India hangs in the balance. The Bangladesh Cricket Board has written to the International Cricket Council, urging it to move the team's matches out of India, citing security concerns.

New Year surprise? Virat Kohli shares training photos on Instagram after 2 yearsVirat Kohli ended a nearly three-year gap by sharing training photos on Instagram. The former India captain posted three images from a practice session with his teammates ahead of the ODI series opener against New Zealand in Vadodara on January 11.

Vinicius Jr vs Diego Simeone explained: Atletico coach criticised for crossing lineReal Madrid booked their place in the 2026 Spanish Super Cup final with a 2-1 win over Atlético Madrid. The match was overshadowed by a heated sideline exchange between Vinícius Jr. and Atletico manager Diego Simeone on Thursday.

Rajinikanth punchline tattooed, New Zealand spinner Adithya Ashok ready to face IndiaNew Zealand leg spinner Adithya Ashok is set to play in the upcoming ODI series against India. Ashok, who has Tamil roots, trained at CSK academy in Chennai in 2025.

Nick Kyrgios withdraws from Australian Open singles, set to compete in doublesNick Kyrgios has announced he will not compete in the singles draw at the Australian Open. He will instead focus on doubles as he recovers from injuries and prepares for future tournaments.

Did BCCI offer IPL return to Mustafizur Rahman? BCB president reacts to rumoursBCB president Aminul Islam Bulbul denies reports of any IPL return talks for Mustafizur Rahman with the BCCI. Bangladesh has also requested ICC to shift its T20 World Cup matches outside India over security concerns.

Watch: Rohit Sharma's priceless reaction after Jay Shah calls him India captainRohit Sharma was warmly called India captain by ICC chairman Jay Shah despite being replaced by Shubman Gill. Rohit led India to two ICC triumphs in 2024 and 2025 under his leadership.

WPL 2026 preview: A SWOT-driven analysis of all five teamsThe 2026 WPL, taking place from January 9 to February 5 with five competitive franchises, promises high-stakes, action-packed women's cricket. Here, we break down each team's strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats.

Malaysia Open Highlights: Satwik-Chirag out in quarters, Sindhu reaches semisMalaysia Open 2026 Highlights: Indian men's doubles pair Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty suffered a rare early exit at the Malaysia Open after losing in straight games to Indonesia's Fajar Alfian and Muhammad Rian Ardianto. Meanwhile, PV Sindhu stormed into the semifinals after spending just 11 minutes on court, winning the opening game 21-11 before third seed Akane Yamaguchi retired due to injury.

WPL 2026: Champions Mumbai Indians meet revamped RCB in blockbuster startThe WPL 2026 season begins with a blockbuster as defending champions Mumbai Indians take on a revamped Royal Challengers Bengaluru side, setting the tone for a high-stakes campaign.

Tilak Varma issues injury update following surgery: On the road to recoveryIndia batter Tilak Varma has reassured the fans that he will be back on the field quickly after undergoing surgery earlier in the week. Tilak will head back to Hyderabad on Friday, January 9 and start his rehabilitation process.

Tata Steel Chess: Viswanathan Anand, Nihal Sarin share lead after six roundsViswanathan Anand and Nihal Sarin finished day two of the Tata Steel Chess India Rapid on top of the Open standings after six rounds, both accumulating 4.5 points. In the women's category, Kateryna Lagno maintained a clear lead with 4.5 points, while Indian participants faced mixed results across the leaderboard.

Vijay Hazare Trophy Roundup: Delhi, Punjab, Vidarbha and UP book quarterfinal spotsDelhi, Punjab, Vidarbha and Uttar Pradesh booked Vijay Hazare Trophy quarterfinal spots as big wins and late drama marked a gripping end to the league stage across multiple groups.

Atiqa Mir shines on junior S125 debut with historic top-five finish at Abu DhabiEleven-year-old Atiqa Mir delivered a stunning junior S125 debut, finishing fifth at Yas Marina to become the first Indian and first female to achieve a top-five finish on debut in IAME UAE history.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
